p: Yellow fever virus (YFV) (family Flaviviridae, genus Flavivirus) is endemic in tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Central and South America. Yellow fever (YF) presents a broad spectrum of severity, with clinical manifestations ranging from self-limited febrile to fatal disease in humans [ 1, 2]. There is no specific treatment for YF, and vaccination is recommended for people who live in or travel to at-risk areas [ 2].
